alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 11:28AM PST until January 22 at 12:45PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE SAN DIEGO COUNTY DESERTS... * WHAT...Areas of flooding caused by moderate to locally rainfall. * WHERE...Northern portions of the San Diego County Deserts, north of Borrego Springs. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1126 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is possible in the advisory area. Between 0.40 and 0.60 inches of rain have fallen in the past 6 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area this afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hwy 78 Between Borrego Springs Rd And Ocotillo Wells, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Borrego Springs, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, I-8 Between Boulevard And Imperial County Line, Fish Creek Wash, Ocotillo Wells, Hwy S2 Between Agua Caliente And Canebrake, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente and Hwy S22 Between Ranchita And Borrego Springs. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
